I got both portal games for $4 in a black friday sale
Played this game both Solo and Co. op. with a friend.  I personally had most fun playing with a friend, but both ways are a blast.  I definitely recommend this game.

After the massive success of Valve's classic Portal, they came back with a smash hit bigger than anything we could've imagined. Cast yourself back into the depths of Aperture science with the increasingly malevolent GLaDOS, and endure the testing once again, now with about 300% more science. With about 3 times the content of the original game, a massive graphics upgrade from the original, and one of the widely regarded best video game character of all time, Portal 2 skyrocketed it's way onto my steam library, and I was hooked. In the complex, puzzle-based world of Aperture, a little character goes a long way. Most players who move at the speed of an average person won't hear about 50% of Wheatley's total lines. I think that says enough, don't you? Highly recommend to anyone who hasn't played before.

I didn't even realize I hadn't written a review of (quite possibly) my favourite game of all time until now.

It's a clever puzzle game with a really interesting story, to put it simply. If you haven't yet played the first Portal, play it first for the fullest experience, then pick this up. You won't regret it one bit. I would seriously reccommend this game to pretty much everyone.
Everything best one of legend game

Great sequel, mixes reasonably challenging puzzles with an interesting story. It has a very different feel to the previous game, but still has good level design and introduces several new concepts, especially in the old Aperture areas.

Also the turrets are cool
